description: Built circa 1310, the moated manor house is the earliest surviving timber framed building in Middlesex. Described as one of the most interesting domestic complexes in the whole country, the fabric of Headstone Manor contains examples of high quality work dating from the 14th, 17th and 18th centuries.

factsheet.heading: Headstone Manor &  Museum
paragraphs:
Visit us at Headstone Manor and Museum, a beautifully restored historic site nestled in the heart of Harrow. Discover over 1,200 years of local history as you explore our stunning medieval buildings, including the Grade I listed Manor House, the charming Granary, and the atmospheric Moat. With engaging exhibitions, family-friendly activities, and the welcoming Moat CafÃ©, thereâ€™s something for everyone to enjoy. Whether you're a history enthusiast or simply looking for a unique day out â€” Headstone Manor and Museum is the perfect place to step back in time.
Dating back to the 14th century, Headstone Manor has witnessed over 700 years of local life â€” from its origins as a medieval moated manor house to its role in farming, industry, and community life. Now lovingly restored, the site brings history to life through fascinating exhibitions, original architecture, and stories of the people who lived and worked here. Come and explore the past in a place where history truly lives!

factsheet.heading: Activities
paragraphs: At Headstone Manor & Museum, thereâ€™s something for everyone with a vibrant mix of family and adult programming throughout the year. Families can enjoy hands-on fun with Explorer Backpacks, interactive trails like Bill the Duck, creative sessions with the Art Cart, and themed events during school holidays. Younger visitors will love the play-based learning in our dedicated Bakehouse space and Mini Museum mornings designed for under-5s. For adults, the museum offers engaging workshops, historical talks, and craft sessions ranging from stained glass making to nature-inspired stitching. Whether you're visiting with children or looking to dive deeper into history and heritage, Headstone Manor & Museum promises a day full of discovery and inspiration.

factsheet.heading: Visit the Museum
paragraphs:
Explore free of charge Tuesday to Sunday from 10â€¯am to 4â€¯pm, with the museum closed on Mondays. You'll find us on Pinner View (HA2â€¯6PX), just a short 15â€‘minute walk or quick bus ride (H9, H10, H14) from Harrow & Wealdstone stationâ€”and thereâ€™s free parking and bike racks on-site. All key buildingsâ€”including the Small Barn entrance, Great Barn, Visitor Centre (Moat CafÃ©), Granary, and the ground floor of the Manor Houseâ€”are wheelchair-accessible, with lifts and tablets available for first-floor exploration. Accessible toilets and baby-changing facilities are located in multiple buildings, and assistance dogs are welcome.
The Moat CafÃ© serves freshly brewed coffee, cakes, and light bites, while the Visitor Centre includes a gift shop. Outside, enjoy the moat, nature trail, gardens, and wildlifeâ€”plus a free Nature Finderâ€™s trail available at reception.
Whether you're visiting solo, with family, or as part of a group, Headstone Manor & Museum offers a warm welcome and a day full of history, heritage, and peaceful parkland.
